issue.title: does it work with `sftp`?
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
I'm trying to connect to a `sftp` server

**Example code**
```jsx
const client = new ftp.Client()
client.ftp.verbose = true;
const response = await client.access({
      host,
      port,
      user,
      password,
      secure: true,
    });

console.log(await client.list());
```

**Console output**
```jsx
Connected to ***.***.****.**:**
< SSH-2.0-CerberusFTPServer_8.0
ftp err:  Error: Timeout (control socket)
    at Socket.<anonymous> (app/node_modules/basic-ftp/dist/FtpContext.js:315:58)
```

**Which version of Node.js are you using?**
node v14.2.0

**Additional context**
I've tried other commands, but it didn't worked

comment.body: The name SFTP seems to imply some similarity to FTP – unfortunately there is no similarity at all. These are completely different protocols, SFTP doesn't have anything to do with FTP. So the answer is still no.

issue.title: How to upload multiple files in parallel?
issue.body:
I want to upload multiple files in parallel, but `uploadFromDir` looks like a serial operation.

Should I create multiple FTP connections using `uploadFrom`?.

issue.title: How to upload multiple files in parallel?
issue.body:
I want to upload multiple files in parallel, but `uploadFromDir` looks like a serial operation.

Should I create multiple FTP connections using `uploadFrom`?.

comment.body: FTP doesn't allow parallel uploads, but you can use multiple FTP sessions to do something similar, yes.

issue.title: downloadToStream Error
downloadToStream Error

comment.body: Yes, you are, or you could use another way to build streams. I will close this ticket because the issue is not specific to this library but rather about Node.js and how to work with streams.

issue.title: R Extension in VS code
issue.body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81575793/190933773-115c762f-8a5b-4aeb-8cb4-e4b1453ea279.png)

I've been trying to solve this problem for days but I couldn't. I can't save files with an .R extension, but with python files it works. I can't even create files from VS code. can someone help me, please?

comment.body: You have opened an issue for the library "basic-ftp" but your troubles seem to concern something entirely different (R, VS-Code). If they are indeed related to "basic-ftp", could you describe in what way?

release.body:
- Fixed: Use existing code path to close control socket when replacing it.
- Fixed: Destroy sockets explicitly on timeouts only.
release.short_description_html:
• Fixed: Use existing code path to close control socket when replacing it.
  • Fixed: Destroy sockets explicitly on timeouts only.

payload.description: FTP client for Node.js, supports FTPS over TLS, passive mode over IPv6, async/await, and Typescript.

commits.message:
Remove obsolete test

FTP servers signal end of transmission by closing connection during
transfer, it's not necessarily an error.
Destroy socket if server doesn't ack the end
Test timeout when connecting to server
Destroy connections before closing mock server

issue.title: Add httpsAgent option on secureOptions for TLS

commits.message: Run CI for versions supported by test env
Run CI for all supported versions
